I, a nonbinary Muslim, wear a headscarf. Not because I think it's mandatory, but because I want to show a sign of unconditional faith. I want people to know that I'm Muslim and that i'm proud of it. Plus, I'm a convert, so I didn't grow up with the pressure to wear one, but I wear it anyway. So it really depends on who you ask. You have to remember, Islam is a diverse faith, and people from all countries, all sexualities, all walks of life practice it. Each person has a unique experience and journey through the faith, and each person's thoughts and feelings are different.
